result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah J McGlorn

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:49 AM Defendant Isaiah J McGlorn in court.  Attorney Pamela Popken in court for Isaiah J McGlorn.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense states in 22CF1078 there is a conflict and will not be able to represent and also requesting to withdraw in other cases due to breakdown in communications.
BTC: Motion to withdraw in all cases granted.  Court to appoint new counsel for defendant.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaiah J McGlorn in court.  Attorney Pamela Popken in court for Isaiah J McGlorn. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Case 20CF1322 is tracking with this case.
Preliminary hearing waived, probable cause found, bound over.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the co-defendant K.J.. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:53 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaiah J McGlorn appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Isaiah J McGlorn. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
